instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
This arrived with no backlight but machine still boots and chimes. minor liquid spill on U8330. Replaced but no change.

There is 5v at the screen but no 0V on backlight. Using a known good screen. EDP_BKLT_EN is only 0.300V

Can this be bad CPU/PCH since EDP_BKLT_EN comes from it?

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
DP_INT_HPD steady high?
Can you confirm if image is present?
LCD_PSR_EN goes high?
Do you get 3V at pin 5 of J8300?

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
DP_INT_HPD steady 2.4v

Yes image is present

LCD_PSR_EN yes 3.3v

yes 3v at pin 5 of j8300

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: Be sure to test with compatible screen for this year model.

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: I am. The same screen works fine on another 4924 board

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
You should have something more affected by liquid.
Compare diode mode to ground readings on that area with the good board.

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message: diode mode readings are very close and some exact to good board

threads.title: 820-4924 no backlight
threads.message:
Possibly liquid spill damaged PCH through the backlight control lines.

Just in case, do PRAM reset 2-3 times.
SMC_LID should be high; check it anyway...
